title: Kunal Kamra asks Blinkit CEO to reveal wages of delivery partners, says quick commerce exploits gig workers - Hindustan Times
summary:
Kunal Kamra Criticizes Quick Commerce for Exploiting Gig Workers

Jan 02, 2025 - Hindustan Times

Comedian Kunal Kamra has criticized quick commerce platforms for exploiting gig workers, highlighting the dark side of convenience. These platforms, such as Blinkit, Swiggy Instamart, and Zepto, deliver groceries and other household goods to customers' doorsteps in minutes. However, Kamra points out the unfair wages and long working hours of gig workers in the industry.

Key Points:

  • Kamra criticized quick commerce platforms for low wages and long hours of gig workers.
  • He specifically targeted Blinkit CEO Albinder Dhindsa, asking him to reveal the average wages of delivery partners.
  • Kamra likened the CEOs of these companies to 'thugs' for exploiting gig workers without proper regulations.
  • Social media users supported Kamra's views, with many agreeing that these platforms exploit workers.
"They are thugs that are using data as oil without paying for the oil fields. Someday there will be regulation that humbles them..." - Kunal Kamra

Kamra's post has gathered over 1.9 lakh views with widespread support from other social media users.
newTitle: Kunal Kamra Criticizes Quick Commerce for Exploiting Gig Workers

title: Wipro shares downgraded by CLSA just six months after a 'double upgrade' - CNBCTV18
summary:
Wipro shares downgraded by CLSA just six months after a 'double upgrade'

Date: Not Provided

Source: CNBC TV18

Brokerage firm CLSA has downgraded Wipro Ltd’s shares from "outperform" to "hold" just six months after issuing a double upgrade, reflecting changes in market performance and expectations.

  • CLSA maintains a price target of ₹303, nearly the same as the current closing price.
  • The downgrade comes as Wipro shares have outperformed in recent months, increasing 3% in the last month and 14% since July last year.
  • Analysts predict Wipro will remain sluggish, forecasting flat Constant Currency growth for the December quarter.
  • Wipro has seen a 1% earnings downgrade for 2024, despite a price-to-earnings ratio increase from 19.7x to 24.4x.
  • Out of 45 analysts, 25 recommend selling, 9 recommend buying, and 11 suggest holding the stock.
"The next leg of re-rating for Wipro can happen only if it starts growing in-line with its other largecap peers." - CLSA

Overall, Wipro's stock performance remains cautious while the firm awaits its upcoming earnings report.
newTitle: Wipro shares downgraded by CLSA just six months after a 'double upgrade'

title: Frog-Themed Altcoin Explodes 32,420% After Elon Musk Suddenly Changes X Username - The Daily Hodl
summary:
Elon Musk's X Username Change Sparks 32,420% Surge in Frog-Themed Altcoin

Published on January 1, 2024 | Source: The Daily Hodl

A frog-themed memecoin, Kekius Maximus (KEKIUS), has surged by over 32,000% after billionaire Elon Musk changed his username on the social media platform X to "Kekius Maximus," a reference to the Egyptian god Kek.

  • Musk's sudden name change led to a staggering increase in KEKIUS' value, from $0.00123 on December 30 to a peak of $0.40 on January 1st.
  • KEKIUS' market cap burgeoned to over $250 million following the surge.
  • Musk, a proponent of meme assets, did not specify a reason for the name change.

"The meme asset has since retraced and is trading for $0.264 at time of writing."
newTitle: Elon Musk's X Username Change Sparks 32,420% Surge in Frog-Themed Altcoin

The Nifty 50 extended gains by 0.4% on January 1, indicating a positive start to 2025. It surpassed the 200-day EMA at 23,700 but still falls short of the 200-day SMA at 23,880, which is pivotal for continued upward movement. title: FPIs pump ₹1.65 lakh cr in Indian markets, equity inflows plunge 99% to ₹427 cr in 2024: What lies ahead in 2025? | Stock Market News - Mint
summary:
FPIs pump ₹1.65 lakh cr in Indian markets, equity inflows plunge 99% to ₹427 cr in 2024: What lies ahead in 2025?

Publication Date: December 2024 | Source: Live Mint

India's Foreign Portfolio Investment (FPI) inflows faced a dramatic decline in 2024, dropping 99% from the previous year. This article explores the reasons behind this downturn and what it may mean for the future.

  • FPI inflows decreased from ₹1.71 lakh crore in 2023 to just ₹2,026 crores in 2024.
  • The strong performance of the US economy led to a shift in investments towards US markets.
  • Concerns over Indian market valuation, GDP growth, and corporate earnings deterred investors.
  • Domestic challenges included a slowdown in government spending due to the 2024 general elections.
  • Despite challenges, some interest in India's primary markets remains, buoyed by domestic investors.
“Many factors are behind the FPI flows tempering in 2024 in India… the strong US economy meant that strong flows went into US money markets, US bonds, and US stock market, to the detriment of Emerging Markets including India.” - Ajay Bagga, Banking and Market Expert

In conclusion, as 2025 approaches, India needs to tackle both global and domestic issues to enhance its appeal to foreign investors and stimulate economic growth.
newTitle: FPIs Investment in Indian Markets Plummets, What to Expect in 2025?

title: Net GST growth slumps to 3.3% in December, as revenues slow and refunds rise 45% - The Hindu
Meet Indian man who spent Rs 550 crore on daughter's wedding, went to jail after going bankrupt due to...; hi - India.com
summary:
Pramod Mittal: Luxury to Bankruptcy

Published on: January 1, 2025

Once among the richest men in the UK, Pramod Mittal, brother of billionaire steel magnate Lakshmi Mittal, spent Rs 550 crore on his daughter's wedding in 2013. However, a series of unfortunate events led to his bankruptcy in 2020, forcing him to depend on his wife and kids for daily expenses.

  1. Guarantor for a loan taken by GIKIL, a metallurgical company based in Bosnia
  2. Arrested in Bosnia in 2019 on charges of fraud
  3. Declared bankrupt in the UK in 2020
  4. Faces money laundering charges in India

Mittal was offering his creditors to pay just 0.18 paise in exchange of every one pound of loan taken by him.

Despite his downfall, Pramod Mittal once hosted a lavish wedding for his daughter, spending around Rs 550 crore, more than his brother Lakshmi Mittal's daughter's wedding in 2004.
newTitle: The Rise and Fall of Pramod Mittal: From Luxurious Daughter's Wedding to Bankruptcy

title: Meet Indian man who spent Rs 550 crore on daughter's wedding, went to jail after going bankrupt due to; his n - India.com
summary:
Meet Indian man who spent Rs 550 crore on daughter’s wedding, went to jail after going bankrupt due to…; his name is…

Published on: [Date not provided] Source: India.com

Pramod Mittal, once among the richest men in the UK, spent an extravagant Rs 550 crore on his daughter's wedding but faced bankruptcy in 2020, accumulating enormous debts.

  • Pramod Mittal is the brother of billionaire Lakshmi Mittal and was once a prominent businessman.
  • He declared bankruptcy in 2020 with debts exceeding 130 million pounds.
  • Mittal had to borrow money from family to meet his monthly expenses.
  • His luxury wedding expenditure led to significant financial troubles, particularly after guaranteeing a loan for a company that defaulted.
  • Mittal faced legal troubles, including fraud and money laundering charges.
“It’s surreal to think Pramod Mittal once spent a whopping Rs 550 crore on the wedding of his daughter Shrishti Mittal.”

This dramatic downfall highlights the precarious nature of wealth and the consequences of extravagant spending.
newTitle: Meet the Indian Man Who Spent Rs 550 Crore on His Daughter's Wedding and Went to Jail

title: Maruti, Toyota, M&M lead in December auto sales, Tata Motors, Hyundai report muted show - The Hindu
summary:
Maruti, Toyota, M&M lead in December auto sales, Tata Motors, Hyundai report muted show

Published: January 01, 2025 08:43 pm IST

Japanese car manufacturers Maruti Suzuki and Toyota Kirloskar Motor reported remarkable sales growth in December, while other players like Tata Motors and Hyundai showed mixed results.

  • Maruti Suzuki reported a 30% sales increase, with 178,248 units sold compared to 137,551 units a year prior.
  • Toyota Kirloskar Motor's sales rose by 29%, totaling 29,529 units.
  • Mahindra & Mahindra observed 16% growth, selling 69,768 units.
  • Tata Motors had a modest 1% increase in sales, reporting 76,599 units.
  • Hyundai experienced a decline of 2.4%, with sales at 55,078 units.
“We are observing a growing shift of consumer preferences towards vehicles offering sustainability, value proposition of dependability quotient, enhanced safety and better resale value which is boosting our sales.” - Sabari Manohar, TKM
“Looking ahead, we remain optimistic about the outlook for the PV industry.” - Shailesh Chandra, Tata Motors

This December saw notable trends in consumer preferences with a focus on sustainability and innovation driving sales in the automotive sector.
newTitle: Maruti Suzuki and Toyota Lead December Auto Sales with Impressive Growth

title: RBI Guv Malhotra asks staff to emphasise customer centricity in NY message - Business Standard
summary:
RBI Governor Sanjay Malhotra's New Year Message: Emphasize Customer Centricity

Date: 2025-01-01 | Source: Business Standard

In his New Year message to RBI employees, Governor Sanjay Malhotra stressed the importance of customer centricity in their endeavors for 2025, an 'exciting and challenging' year ahead.

  1. Malhotra asked staff to focus on providing seamless and user-friendly services.
  2. The Indian rupee depreciated nearly 3% in 2024, touching an all-time low, and has been under pressure for the last three months.
  3. Economic growth slowed, with GDP growth in Q2 at 5.4%, and retail inflation fell to 5.5%.
  4. Malhotra will chair his first MPC meeting in February, with the policy repo rate unchanged at 6.5% for nearly two years.
“Let us keep customer centricity at the heart of our endeavours and work towards providing seamless and user-friendly services.” – Sanjay Malhotra, RBI Governor

Malhotra took charge in December 2024, succeeding Shaktikanta Das, and highlighted the RBI's achievements in 2024, including enhancing customer protection, promoting financial literacy, and encouraging innovation.
newTitle: RBI Governor Malhotra's New Year Message: Emphasize Customer Centricity

title: Ahead of Market: 10 things that will decide stock market action on Thursday - The Economic Times
Filing ITR: Last 90 days to claim tax exemption via investments for fiscal year 2025. Check details here | Mint - Mint
summary:
Filing ITR: Last 90 days to claim tax exemption via investments for fiscal year 2025. Check details here

Publication Date: 2025-03-31 Source: Live Mint

The financial year 2025 is drawing to a close, but there are still opportunities for taxpayers to invest in tax-saving schemes to claim exemptions for fiscal year 2024-25 by the July 31 deadline.

  • Investments must be made in the same financial year to be eligible for tax exemption.
  • Taxpayers can invest in various instruments under Section 80C, 80CCC, 80CCD (1), and 80D for tax deductions.
  • The maximum exemption limit under Sections 80C, 80CCC, and 80CCD(1) combined is ₹1.5 lakh.
  • Tax deduction for medical insurance premiums under Section 80D can reach ₹25,000 for regular citizens and ₹50,000 for senior citizens.
  • Contributions to the National Pension Scheme (NPS) allow for additional deductions under Section 80CCD (1B).
"It is important to note that taxpayers must opt for the old tax regime in order to claim tax exemptions since most of these exemptions are not allowed in the new regime."

Taxpayers are encouraged to act quickly to take advantage of these deductions before the fiscal year ends on March 31, 2025.
newTitle: Last Chance to Claim Tax Exemptions for Fiscal Year 2025

title: RJio readying up to ₹40,000 cr IPO with $120 billion valuation - BusinessLine
summary:
Reliance Jio Plans Major IPO Valued at $120 Billion

Date: January 01, 2025 | Source: The Hindu Business Line

Billionaire Mukesh Ambani has initiated the process for an initial public offer (IPO) for Reliance Jio Infocomm, aiming for a size between ₹35,000-40,000 crore.

  • The IPO will comprise both an offer for sale and a fresh issue, with goals set for the second half of the year.
  • This IPO could potentially become the largest ever in India.
  • Preliminary talks for a pre-IPO placement have already commenced.
  • RJio's valuation is estimated between $100 billion and $120 billion, with significant focus on next-generation technologies.
  • Reliance Jio is currently the largest telecom operator in India with 460 million subscribers.
“The OFS component is likely to be significant as it would provide the opportunity for a partial or full exit for many of the investors in it.”

In conclusion, the upcoming IPO of Reliance Jio is poised to be a landmark event in the Indian financial market, reflecting the company's significant growth and the evolving tech landscape.
newTitle: Reliance Jio Plans Major IPO Valued at $120 Billion

title: Former Nesco ind director pays ₹21.45 lakh to settle disclosure violation case with Sebi | Company Business News - Mint
summary:
Former Nesco Independent Director Settles Disclosure Case with Sebi for ₹21.45 Lakh

Date: January 1, 2024 Source: PTI

Manu M Parpia, a former independent director of Nesco Ltd, has settled with the Securities and Exchange Board of India (Sebi) over a case of alleged disclosure violations by paying ₹21.45 lakh.

  • The settlement was reached without admitting or denying the findings.
  • The case arose after a report from Stakeholders Empowerment Services prompted an examination by Sebi.
  • Parpia was accused of serving on the board for over a year after the end of his tenure.
  • He allegedly provided misleading information regarding his independence during his appointment.
Sebi's Chief General Manager G Ramar stated, "The instant proceedings initiated against the applicant are disposed of."

This settlement marks the resolution of allegations against Parpia while underlining the importance of compliance with board responsibilities and regulatory norms.
newTitle: Former Nesco Independent Director Settles Disclosure Case with Sebi for ₹21.45 Lakh
